tool_description: Galactic cosmic radiation and trapped radiation environments for your mission profile
name: Space Radiation API
title: Space Radiation API

api_list.name: app.api.endpoints.TrappedRadiation.calculate_flux_percentile

required_parameters.name: coord1
required_parameters.description:
First coordinate value to specify position.

Ordering for GEI, GEO coords:X, Y, Z
Ordering for GDZ coords: Alt, Lat, Long
Valid ranges for latitude: -90, 90
Valid ranges for longitude: 0, 360

required_parameters.name: model
required_parameters.description:
Which model to use:

- Energetic electrons (AE9)
- Energetic protons (AP9)
- Space plasma model for electrons (SPME)
- for hydrogen (SPMH)
- for helium (SPMHE)
- for oxygen (SPMO)

required_parameters.name: coord_sys
required_parameters.description:
Coordinate system to use:

- Geodetic/WGS84 (GDZ)
- Geocentric Cartesian (GEO)
- Geocentric Earth Inertial (GEI)
See "Bhavnani, K. H., & Vancour, R. P. (1991). Coordinate systems for space and geophysical applications" for coord system definitions.

required_parameters.name: coord_units
required_parameters.description: Coordinate units to use: km (KM) or Earth Radii (RE)

required_parameters.name: percentile
required_parameters.description: Integer percentile at which to calc flux (50 is the median value).

energies.description: Particle energies at which omnidirectional flux values are calculated, and their units.

flux.description: Corresponding omnidirectional flux values, and their units.

required_parameters.name: coord_sys

api_list.name: app.api.endpoints.GCR.calculate_dlr_flux
api_list.description: for the given energy, atomic number, and date.

required_parameters.name: energy
required_parameters.description:
Particle energy in MeV/n
Valid range: [0, 106] MeV/n
